John_King_(country_singer):
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Other people|John King|John King (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = John King | image = JohnKingMountainShot.jpg | landscape = | alt = | caption = John King at Yosemite National Park in 2018 | birth_name = John Lee King | birth_place = [[Demorest, Georgia]] | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]] | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | instrument = Vocals/Guitar | years_active = 2014–present | label = Starstruck Records | website = {{URL|www.johnkingcountry.com}} }} '''John King''' is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter. King was born and raised in [[Demorest, Georgia]]. He worked construction jobs as a teenager and was heavily influenced by Country, Rock and [[Southern rock]] artists. King later graduated from [[University of Georgia]] before signing his first record deal with [[Black River Entertainment]] (2014-2016).{{cite web|url=https://www.johnkingcountry.com/|title=John King|website=John King}} His debut single, "Tonight Tonight", was released in mid-2014 and featured on the [[NFL|NFL's]]{{Cite web|url=https://www.nfl.com/|title=NFL.com - Official Site of the National Football League|website=www.nfl.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-06-14}} Thursday Night Football on [[CBS]]. [[Taste of Country]] reviewed it favorably, saying that it is "a great hook over a strong beat, all built sturdy country voice. King solidly follows in the footsteps of many modern country hit-makers, unveiling a debut single that is fun and catchy and will immediately have one hitting repeat for a second listen."{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/john-king-tonight-tonight/|title=John King, 'Tonight Tonight' [Listen]|first=Taste of Country|last=Staff|website=Taste of Country|date=5 June 2014 }} It entered Top 40 on [[Country Airplay]] for the chart dated September 13, 2014.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/biz|title=Billboard biz|last=alex|date=21 April 2018|magazine=Billboard}} King co-wrote [[Randy Houser]]'s single "[[We Went]]" with Justin Wilson, Matt Rogers, the song reached #1 on Mediabase{{Cite web|url=http://www.mediabase.com|title=Mediabase 24/7 - Logon|website=www.mediabase.com|access-date=2018-06-14}} and Billboard{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts|title=Charts {{!}} Billboard|magazine=Billboard|access-date=2018-06-14}} [[Country Airplay]] Charts.{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/artist/360710/Randy+Houser/chart?f=1226|title=Randy Houser - Chart history - Billboard|website=www.billboard.com}} It also scored him his first [[American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers|ASCAP]] Songwriter Award in 2016. King also penned the first [[Hootie & the Blowfish|Hootie and The Blowfish]] song to be released since 2005. “Rollin” is featured on their new album, "Imperfect Circle" that was released November 1, 2019.{{Citation|title=Rollin' by Hootie & The Blowfish|url=https://music.apple.com/us/album/imperfect-circle/1478791238?i=1478791723|language=en-us|access-date=2019-11-11}} The video for King's 2017 "I Still Pick Up" was voted Top 10 on the [[CMT (U.S. TV channel)|CMT]]countdown.{{Cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/shows/hot-20-countdown|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170621000401/http://www.cmt.com/shows/hot-20-countdown|url-status=dead|archive-date=June 21, 2017|title=CMT Hot 20 Countdown {{!}} Episodes (TV Series)|website=CMT|access-date=2018-06-14}} King signed [[Sony/ATV Music Publishing|Sony/ATV]] Nashville in April 2018.{{Cite web|url=https://www.sonyatv.com/|title=Sony/ATV|website=www.sonyatv.com|language=en|access-date=2018-06-14}} King’s single, “Try Saying Goodbye” pulls from his storytelling prowess. It has already garnered more than 15 million streams{{Citation|title=Try Saying Goodbye|url=https://music.apple.com/us/album/try-saying-goodbye/1448487412?i=1448487420|language=en|access-date=2019-11-11}} and 30 major market radio adds including Atlanta, Boston and Seattle. It was named one of Rolling Stone’s Top 10 Country Songs,{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/best-country-songs-aaron-watson-im-with-her-785273/|title=10 Best Country, Americana Songs to Hear Now: Aaron Watson, I'm With Her|last=Crawford|first=Robert|date=2019-01-28|magazine=Rolling Stone|language=en-US|access-date=2019-11-11}} earning features from Amazon, Whiskey Riff, Taste of Country{{Cite web|url=https://tasteofcountry.com/john-king-try-saying-goodbye/|title=John King Strikes Universal Chord in 'Try Saying Goodbye'|last=Whitaker|first=Sterling|website=Taste of Country|date=24 January 2019 |language=en|access-date=2019-11-11}} and more. On his debut album '''‘Always Gonna Be You,’''' King shines light on the most important things in life: family and faith. ‘Always Gonna Be You’ is available everywhere. '''''American Songwriter''''' says the album “establishes the Georgia native as a boundless artist with an undeniable talent for truth-telling."
